metadata.title: USN-3524-1 -- Linux kernel vulnerability
metadata.description: Jann Horn discovered that microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and indirect branch prediction may allow unauthorized memory reads via sidechannel attacks. This flaw is known as Meltdown. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information, including kernel memory.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3524-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-image-3.13.0-139-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-139.188 linux-image-3.13.0-139-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-139.188 linux-image-3.13.0-139-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-139.188 linux-image-3.13.0-139-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-139.188 linux-image-extra-3.13.0-139-generic - 3.13.0-139.188 linux-image-3.13.0-139-generic - 3.13.0-139.188 linux-image-3.13.0-139-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-139.188 linux-image-3.13.0-139-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-139.188 linux-image-3.13.0-139-lowlatency - 3.13.0-139.188 No subscription required
